etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, 'wood') + 乍(乍) (zhà, 'at first') = tree species indicated by phonetic 乍
etymology.interpretation: The character 柞(柞) (zhà, 'oak') combines 木(木) (mù, 'wood'), which indicates that the character relates to trees or wood, with 乍(乍) (zhà, 'at first'; phonetic) to suggest the pronunciation. The character refers specifically to a type of tree, namely the oak.

examples.chinese: 他采集了柞木(他採集了柞木)，打算制作家具(打算製作傢俱)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cǎijí le zhà mù, dǎsuàn zhìzuò jiājù.
examples.english: He collected oak wood, planning to make furniture.

examples.chinese: 古代文献记载柞木有很高的使用价值(古代文獻記載柞木有很高的使用價值)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài wénxiàn jìzǎi zhà mù yǒu hěn gāo de shǐyòng jiàzhí.
examples.english: Ancient texts recorded that oak wood held great value.
